qas.question: Who was the son of Sarjun?
Along with Rhodes, what Byzantine possession did Muawiyah occupy?
Who group of Christians rose up against Muawiyah?
What did Muawiyah found in North Africa?
Who discouraged peaceful coexistence with the Christians in Syria?
Who was Muawiyah's least close adviser?
When were Rhodes and Crete freed from occupation?
Who oversaw a military withdrawal in North Africa?
Where did Muawiya shrink military expansion in?

context: <b4_0>Muawiyah<b4_0/> also encouraged peaceful coexistence with the Christian communities of Syria, granting his reign with "peace and prosperity for Christians and Arabs alike", and one of his closest advisers was <b5_0>Sarjun<b5_0/>, the father of <a0_0>John of Damascus<a0_0/>. At the same time, he waged unceasing war against the Byzantine Roman Empire. <b6_0>During his reign<b6_0/>, Rhodes and <a1_0>Crete<a1_0/> were occupied, and several assaults were launched against Constantinople. After their failure, and faced with a large-scale Christian uprising in the form of the <a2_0>Mardaites<a2_0/>, Muawiyah concluded a peace with Byzantium. <b7_0>Muawiyah<b7_0/> also oversaw military expansion in North Africa (the foundation of <a3_0>Kairouan<a3_0/>) and in <b8_0>Central Asia<b8_0/> (the conquest of Kabul, Bukhara, and Samarkand).
